TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SpecialSettingAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Indicates that an application settings property has a special significance. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Certain application settings properties have a special significance that alters the way in which their associated settings provider should process them. The <xref:System.Configuration.SpecialSettingAttribute> is used to identify such properties. This class uses the <xref:System.Configuration.SpecialSetting?displayProperty=fullName> enumeration to indicate what special category the property belongs to.
<xref:System.Configuration.SpecialSettingAttribute> can only be applied to the settings class or to the individual settings property.
For an example of how a settings provider deals with the <xref:System.Configuration.SpecialSettingAttribute>, see the <xref:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.GetPropertyValues%2A> method of the <xref:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Configuration.SpecialSetting setting) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the value describing the special setting category of the application settings property.
Docs.value: A enumeration value defining the category of the application settings property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Configuration.SpecialSettingAttribute.SpecialSetting%2A> property is set in the <xref:System.Configuration.SpecialSettingAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor of this class.
